User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.1) Gecko/20061010 Firefox/2.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.1) Gecko/20061010 Firefox/2.0

From Firefox 1.5 up to current release of firefox
I'm seeing a Segmentation Fault in history loading
just when history grows, about 1 week.
I've traced this on My Firefox 2.0 and it looked like
this :
(gdb) c
Continuing.

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread -1221318976 (LWP 6060)]

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Me My self would find this if my history grows a little
2.After that just pressing Ctrl+H to view history closes firefox
3.

Actual Results:  
Segmentation Fault --> Crash

Expected Results:  
Viewing History Normally

Linux CompaqAli 2.6.15 #7 SMP PREEMPT Sun Feb 19 23:35:17 CET 2006 i686 GNU/Linux

libc.so.6

I didn't find any way to attach my history.dat file.
:(
comments.creator: nadalizadeh@gmail.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 249502
My history.dat causing this crash

please use talkback or build your own --disable-optimize and one of: --enable-debug or --enable-debugger-info-modules

your stack trace is virtually useless since it can barely reliably tell us which libraries were involved in the crash -- and even that requires more effort than i'm willing to expend.
comments.author: timeless@bemail.org
comments.creator: timeless@bemail.org
comments.raw_text:
please use talkback or build your own --disable-optimize and one of: --enable-debug or --enable-debugger-info-modules

your stack trace is virtually useless since it can barely reliably tell us which libraries were involved in the crash -- and even that requires more effort than i'm willing to expend.

comments.text: -> incomplete since no reply to comment #2, the question from timeless for a more useful stack trace.

comments.creator: nadalizadeh@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
I tried to regenerate the bug and handle it with talkback
but my talkback doesn't send the information automatically.
It says :
1) Connecting
2) Receiving...
3) OH --> Receive failed.

So I attached my talkback configuration directory named .fullcircle in my
home dir.I just have 1 bug in the queue.Thats it.

See if it's usefull or not.
comments.text:
Created attachment 266762
My talkback configuration directory since it doesn't automatically send it !!!!

I tried to regenerate the bug and handle it with talkback
but my talkback doesn't send the information automatically.
It says :
1) Connecting
2) Receiving...
3) OH --> Receive failed.

So I attached my talkback configuration directory named .fullcircle in my
home dir.I just have 1 bug in the queue.Thats it.

See if it's usefull or not.
comments.author: nadalizadeh@gmail.com
